The downsides of smoking

Cigarettes are known for how dangerous they are all around the world, but people don’t seem to stop smoking them. Smoking is known to be the main cause of many life-threatening situations like lung disease, lung cancer, and Heart failure. The damage done by cigarettes are usually irreversible. In the United States the mortality rate is 3 times the mortality rate of people who never smoked. Despite that it is beneficial to healing these scars left on your organs by stopping smoking. People that were shown to quit smoking by the time they were 35 actually had the same average lifespan as people who have never smoked in their life.

Around 480,000 people die every year from smoking. The chance for living to age 80 years old is about 70% unless you are a smoker which in that case would be 35%. It is estimated that 28.3 million adults are currently smoking in the United States and that is not including teenagers smoking them illegally. This is insane because not only are these people hurt from this, but secondhand smoke has also caused 41,000 deaths. These chronic smokers are not only killing themselves but also the people around them. Smoking has been responsible for 90% of lung cancer deaths.

Smoking doesn’t only kill the lungs though, smoking hurts almost every organ in the body. They are a risk to your lungs, heart, immune system, eyes, skin, etc. Smoking sucks tar into your lungs which gets converted into the blood. Once in the blood the tar spreads all over the body and affects everything around. Cigarettes also can affect reproductive systems. Tabacco is known to reduce fertility in both women and men. So, the age-old question is do the pros of smoking outweigh the cons.
